header.title: Girl, 3, told to ‘f**k off back to Syria’ as TfL ‘stood by and did nothing’
header.postText: A mum says her 3-year-old daughter was left shaken after the pair were subjected to ‘racial and Islamophobic abuse’ at an underground station, while TfL staff ‘did nothing to help’.', 'Rashina Begum posted about the incident on social media and alleges they were told to ‘go back to Syria’ and ‘f*ck off back to your country’ at Mile End station at around 2pm on Sunday 24 February by a ‘white male’.', 'An infuriated Ms Begum says she immediately informed TfL staff about the incident and was led into an office, as another station member went down to the platform.', 'However, ‘matters were made worse’ when she could see from the CCTV in the office that the ‘perpetrator had his hand shaken by the TFL staff member’ and was let ‘onto a train’.', 'Ms Begum said she was ‘outraged’ by the way in which TfL staff had handled the incident, adding that she had protested about why the man hadn’t been taken aside and had his name and details reported to the police.', 'She said: ‘This is clearly a racial incident which involved my 3-year-old girl who was absolutely shook up by the ordeal.', '‘This grown up adult cannot get away with this in this day and age.’', 'Rashina says she has since logged the complaint with TfL and is ‘still awaiting a response’, saying she wanted footage of the incident to help police identify the ‘racist who abused me and my child’ and an ‘investigation into staff behaviour’.', 'TfL’s director of policing Siwan Hayward said: ‘All of our customers have every right to travel without fear of abuse and we are urgently investigating this incident with our Mile End station team.', '‘We encourage anybody who experiences verbal or physical assault to report it to the police immediately or to our staff who are trained to contact the police and offer assistance.’
